title: Red Carpet Fashion - Wall Street Journal (subscription)

organizations.name: atelier versace couture nicole kidman mike
tom ford black peak lapel buckley

text: Best Supporting Actor nominee going all black in Ermenegildo Zegna Couture Emma Stone Frazer Harrison/Getty Images Emma Stone a red-carpet darling and a Best Actress nominee for her role in "La La Land," wore a custom made Givenchy Haute Couture by Riccardo Tisci long dress in all over embroidered nude lace, with fishnet embroidery in gold crystals and tubes, 3D cream, gold and bronze Swarovski crystals embroidery, and cream to bronze dégradé crystal fringes, worn with bronze satin sandals Andrew Garfield Valerie Macon/Agence France-Presse/Getty Images Andrew Garfield a Best Actor nominee for "Hacksaw Ridge," is wearing a Tom Ford Black Peak Lapel Buckley tuxedo with satin details, classic black satin bow tie and cummerbund, ivory silk pocket square and patent evening loafers. Read more Frazer Harrison/Getty Images Dev Patel a Best Supporting Actor nominee, is wearing a custom made white silk peak lapel tuxedo jacket and black trousers by Burberry. Octavia Spencer Frazer Harrison/Getty Images Octavia Spencer a nominee for Best Supporting Actress. She is wearing a dress by Marchesa, shoes by Stuart Weitzman and jewels by Forevermark Diamonds. Halle Berry Halle Berry who in 2002, became the first Black woman to win the Best Actress Oscar, is wearing Atelier Versace Couture Nicole Kidman Mike Nelson/European Pressphoto Agency Nicole Kidman The Best Supporting Actress nominee is wearing a custom Armani Privé backless, apricot-colored gown, whose lace overlay is hand-embroidered with arabesque motifs of deep and pale orange crystals with a tulle plissé embroidered train. Viggo Mortensen Valerie Macon/Agence France-Presse/Getty Images Viggo Mortensen a Best Actor nominee for his role in "Captain Fantastic," is wearing a navy wool and silk satin three-piece tuxedo, white cotton shirt with French cuffs, navy silk bow tie, and black patent leather derbies by Dior Homme. Dakota Johnson
